greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Eigentriangle, row sums = (2n + 1).
comment: Sum of n-th row terms = rightmost term of next row.
formula: Eigentriangle by rows, T(n,k) = A078050(n-k) * X; where X = an infinite lower triangular matrix with (1, 1, 3, 5, 7, 9,...) in the main diagonal and the rest zeros. A078050 is signed: (1, 2, 0, -4, -4, 4, 12, 4, -20, -28,...) = the INVERTi transform of the odd numbers: (1, 3, 5, 7,...).
example: First few rows of the triangle =
Row 3 = (-4, 0, 6, 5) = (-4*1, 0*1, 3*2, 5*1) = termwise product of (-4, 0, 2, 1) and (1, 1, 3, 5); where (-4, 0, 2, 1) = the first 4 terms of signed A078050 (reversed).
results.author: _Gary W. Adamson_, Sep 11 2008
